answers.answer: Hi there...I am on this site tonight because my 11 year old is suffering from anxiety as well.  I just want to let you know that I have had major panic attacks, anxiety...most of my life.  I am not sure how old you are, so I would talk to your doctor, but Zoloft helped me so much.  I have been saved by this drug.  I have been taking it for 10 years and I have so much more confidence in myself and my ability to handle what life throws at me. I am a much braver person.  I do not have the fears that crippled me before Zoloft.  I want you to really check this out. You DON"T need to suffer through this HEALTH problem.  It really sounds to me like Anxiety is the root of the problems you are having physically.  I have been through some of the symptoms you have shared and I know that there is real hope for you to get better.  Please check it out.Best wishes and I will pray for you.
thank you. i appreciate the feedback. i am going to the doctor on wednesday so i hope he can help me.

The symptoms you are experience can be as a result of hypoglycemia.  Many people diagnosed with anxiety/depression later find  out they have hypoglycemia.   Pursue both avenues as neither can be ruled out.  see:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypoglycemia#Signs_and_symptoms

Hi bethbell,I have had anxiety for 4 years or so and have had different symptoms all the time (more so 4 years ago)..I was just wondering though, when you went to the hospital, did they talk to you about the blood sugar? It sounds like the low sugar count (57) could have caused you to feel faint, tingly, etc.  Next time you feel that way, try some orange juice/fruit punch or something like that; it might help right away, and then you can try to pinpoint if it was the low sugar that was causing the balance issues/tingling....I used to fear not so much death per se, but the unknown, and also, monitor my heart etc.. I have learned, with a lot of practice, to simply be in the moment NOW...when you are not thinking of anything..things are ok (and in the real scheme of the world, it is!! )..... let us know how things are soon:) ttyl.....

hello i will def try to pinpoint the hypoglycemia next time i feel any of these things. i def know that i am constantly thinking alot. i mean i am such an anxious person i hate it. i was always a lil anxious since i was a child but when i turned 18 or 19 it just went out of wack i got so bad i kept going to the hospital thought i was dying. i dont even know whats normal on my body anymore. like if a bone cracks i feel like my bones are going soft. its crazy. i feel crazy and im so tired of it it gets me so depressed. :( but yeah the whole blood sugar thing is scary but id rather have it be that then anything more serious. so i actually hope its that so that i can be a little more calm. cuz i always think of the worst.

Yes, stay in touch and keep us informed of your condition.  I know a couple of girls (family members) who have been thru what you are going thru.  You are not alone, although I know that you might feel that way.  I am so glad you reached out because you will find what you need by doing so.  Take a deep breath and try to be hopeful.  There is help for you and the journey you are on will bring you to that help.  Good luck on Wednesday at the Doctors.  I wish the best for you!!

PROCEDURE: Sagittal T1. Axial T1, T2, FLAIR, diffusionCOMPARISON: CT from 2008FINDINGS: There is symmetric focal T2 hyperintensity and restricted diffusioninvolving only the splenium of corpus callosum. The brain is otherwise normalin signal intensity on all pulse sequences. No hemorrhage, mass effect,extra-axial collection. The basilar flow-voids are present. The calvarium,skull base, craniocervical relationships, and visualized extracranialstructures are remarkable for mild mucoperiosteal thickening and polypoidchange in the paranasal sinuses.IMPRESSION: Isolated focal abnormality in the splenium of the corpus callosumis quite unusual in a patient without known history of multiple sclerosis,traumatic diffuse axonal injury, or status epilepticus. Consider drugtoxicity, transient metabolic derangement, encephalitis or ADEM, PML, rareneoplasm, or hypoglycemia. Doubt hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy or posteriorreversible encephalopathy in the absence of known preeclampsia/eclampsia.
I don't understand the diagnosis.  Are they telling you you might have MS?  Gosh, I hope not.  Let me know.

well they are just putting that in there as like "it could be this or it could be this or it could be that" according to the doc it could be anything..so they are trying to do all kinds of tests to rule out everything. im probably gonna have to have a spinal tap done.

Oh wow.  I will pray for you that everything goes as well as it can.  I hope you are doing ok and just know that whatever you face, with family and friends to support you, you will be able to handle it.Keep in touch. I am very curious as to finding out your situation.all the best!

Hi,I just read your posts and I wanted to say I really hope that you start feeling better soon and that they figure out what is going on with you...`Did you say you have Lyme's Disease?  If so do the drs think that this could have anything to do with what you are experiencing now?  My cousing has it and for awhile he went through a really hard time but he got treatment and now he is doing great.I am so sorry you are going through this.  Please keep us posted on your progress.  This forum is a great place for support.Feel better soon....

well im being treated for it now. ive only been on meds for a couple days im hoping it will heal me..if not we have to choose another med. which would be IV meds. its so stressful but thanks for reading. what did your friend go through as far as symptoms and how long did he have it and all that?

My cousin was in his early 20's when he got Lymes he is now 30,  I am not sure of all his symptoms but I know that he was really weak, he couldn't eat, tired all the time and he had problems with nausea.He had gone to many dr's and tried many meds but nothing really worked for him.  Eventually he found an infectious disease dr that specializes in Lymes.  He ended up doing the IV meds and he said it was the best decision he has ever made.  He had a pick line for a few months but he only hooked up to the meds at night.  During the day he went through his normal routine.It has been about a year since his treatment and he is like a new person.  He looks healthy and he says he feels great.  So far for him the treatment was a success.I really hope things work out for you.....Keep us posted....

hi im brandon and im just saying to beleive in yourself and look to others for help and to cheer you up,and too trust in the lord and i pray that things get better and you can continue living your life happy and care free
thank you. god bless. im tryin to keep the faith and im praying that God does a miracle work in me. amen

question: I have bad anxiety. I feel alot of symptoms im constantly in fear of dying. I had an mri done it showed an abnormality in my brain. They said it could be anything from hypoglycemia to ms. Today i went to the hospital cuz i felt faint and my blood sugar was 57. Normal blood sugar is supposed to be 100. So im starting to think its hypoglycemia. But i also think i have a nerve damage or something. I feel all kinds of electric shock feelings all over my body tingling prickling. cold hot sensations. burning sensations..balance issues. sleep issues trembling...etc etc. help!!!!!!!! i also wondered if the anxiety disorder could be causing all these other symptoms as well. i mean even though i had a little abnormality the neurologist made it seem like it wasnt life threatening or anything. idk im so lost. help im going through it. and i have been feelin real dizzy these past couple of days. as well as a little weak but not extremely weak just a little.
title: HORRIBLE ANXIETY ATTACKS...help
